newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Brazil telecom bill faces final vote in Congress.
newsitem.headline: Brazil telecom bill faces final vote in Congress.

text.p: A bill regulating the opening up Brazil's telecommunications industry to the private sector faces one final vote in Congress after clearing three Senate committees Tuesday, an official said.
The committees finished voting on the General Telecommunications Law when they rejected a series of proposed amendments to its text, the official said.
The bill must now be approved on the floor of the Senate. Government whips said they would put forward a motion later Tuesday which would allow that vote to take place Thursday.
The bill paves the way for the privatization of the federally owned Telebras system by setting down rules for how the telecommunications sector will operate in a competitive environment.
The bill does not set any limits on foreign capital in Brazilian telecommunications operators but gives the president of the republic powers to limit non-Brazilian investors on a case-by-case basis.
The law would also create a new regulator and set down rules for private companies operating in the sector.
